ground_truth: A police officer escorts Jenny to her grandmother's trailer, where Jenny's grandmother meets her outside and leads her toward the trailer. Jenny later climbs over a second-floor railing and enters the house, lying in bed next to young Forrest and hugging him. As teenagers, Forrest and Jenny walk along an oak-lined road until Forrest is suddenly hit in the back with a rock. They turn around to see a teenage boy throwing another rock, just as a pickup truck pulls up. Jenny turns and looks at Forrest, who drops his books and runs down the road. The teenage boy jumps into the back of the pickup truck with another boy as the truck speeds after Forrest, and Jenny steps left to get out of the way. Forrest leaps over a five-foot fence as the boys try to catch him and looks left while continuing to tell his life story. He runs along the road in front of the high school as the truck chases him and the boys pound on the roof. Forrest runs under the field goal post and through the end zone. The crowd roars with excitement as a football is kicked off and players run around the field. Forrest is seen in a University of Alabama football uniform, looking up into the cheering crowd as his teammate fields the kickoff and hands him the ball. The football coach, assistants, and Alabama players cheer for Forrest as he runs across the field, speeds past defending and opposing players. The football coach runs along the sidelines yelling, while Forrest cuts toward the sidelines, and two opposing players collide. The football coach, assistants, and players motion for Forrest to run toward the end zone. Forrest turns up the sidelines and runs toward the end zone as some opposing players fall down, trying to catch him. He runs into the end zone as an opposing player dives at his feet, and the referee signals a touchdown as the crowd cheers wildly. Forrest continues to run, smashing through band members, and makes his way toward the team tunnel. The football coach looks at an assistant coach as an anchorman named Chet Huntley appears on television. Forrest walks through a crowd of people and steps over to a young man as the crowd observes the demonstration. Forrest walks toward the schoolhouse as a football coach looks at a black and white television, where a newsman outside the schoolhouse speaks to the camera. The footage then cuts to Governor Wallace speaking to General Graham.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A law enforcement officer accompanies Jenny to her grandmother's caravan, where Jenny's grandmother greets her outside and guides her toward the caravan. Jenny later ascends over a second-floor balustrade and enters the house, reclining in bed next to youthful Forrest and embracing him. As adolescents, Forrest and Jenny stroll along an oak-bordered road until Forrest is abruptly struck in the back with a stone. They pivot around to witness a teenage boy hurling another stone, just as a pickup truck approaches. Jenny turns and gazes at Forrest, who drops his textbooks and sprints down the road. The teenage boy leaps into the rear of the pickup truck with another boy as the truck accelerates after Forrest, and Jenny steps aside to get out of the path. Forrest vaults over a five-foot barrier as the boys attempt to capture him and looks left while continuing to narrate his life story. He dashes along the road in front of the high school as the truck pursues him and the boys pound on the roof. Forrest runs below the field goal post and through the end zone. The crowd roars with elation as a football is kicked off and players sprint around the field. Forrest is observed in a University of Alabama football attire, glancing up into the applauding crowd as his teammate catches the kickoff and hands him the sphere. The football coach, aides, and Alabama players cheer for Forrest as he dashes across the field, zooms past defensive and opposing players. The football coach runs along the sidelines shouting, while Forrest veers toward the sidelines, and two opposing players crash. The football coach, aides, and players gesture for Forrest to run toward the end zone. Forrest turns up the sidelines and runs toward the end zone as some opposing players tumble, attempting to seize him. He runs into the end zone as an opposing player lunges at his feet, and the referee indicates a touchdown as the crowd cheers exuberantly. Forrest continues to run, breaking through band participants, and makes his way toward the team tunnel. The football coach glances at an assistant coach as an anchorman named Chet Huntley emerges on television. Forrest walks through a gathering of people and steps over to a young man as the crowd watches the demonstration. Forrest walks toward the schoolhouse as a football coach glances at a black and white television, where a newsman outside the schoolhouse addresses the camera. The footage then cuts to Governor Wallace speaking to General Graham.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A police officer escorts Jenny to her grandmother's trailer, where her grandmother meets her and leads her inside. Jenny later climbs over a second-floor railing, enters the house, and lies in bed next to young Forrest, hugging him. As teenagers, Forrest and Jenny walk along an oak-lined road when Forrest is hit in the back with a rock. They turn to see a teenage boy throwing another rock as a pickup truck arrives. Jenny looks at Forrest, who drops his books and runs. The boy jumps into the truck with another as it speeds after Forrest, and Jenny steps aside. Forrest leaps over a five-foot fence while narrating his life story. He runs along the road in front of the high school as the truck chases him, and the boys pound on the roof. Forrest runs under the field goal post and through the end zone. The crowd roars as a football is kicked off, and players run around the field. Forrest, in a University of Alabama football uniform, looks into the cheering crowd as his teammate hands him the ball. The coach, assistants, and players cheer as Forrest speeds past defenders. The coach runs along the sidelines, yelling, while Forrest cuts toward the sidelines, causing two opposing players to collide. The coach and players motion for Forrest to run to the end zone. Forrest turns up the sidelines, runs into the end zone as an opposing player dives at his feet, and the referee signals a touchdown as the crowd cheers. Forrest continues running, smashing through band members, toward the team tunnel. The coach looks at an assistant as anchorman Chet Huntley appears on TV. Forrest walks through a crowd and steps over to a young man as the crowd observes a demonstration. Forrest walks toward the schoolhouse as a coach watches a black and white TV, where a newsman speaks outside the schoolhouse. The footage cuts to Governor Wallace speaking to General Graham.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A police officer escorts Jenny to her grandmother's trailer, where her grandmother meets her and leads her inside. Jenny later climbs a second-floor railing, enters the house, and lies in bed next to young Forrest, hugging him. As teenagers, Forrest and Jenny walk along an oak-lined road until a rock hits Forrest's back. They see a teenage boy throwing another rock as a pickup truck arrives. Jenny looks at Forrest, who drops his books and runs. The boy jumps into the truck, which chases Forrest, while Jenny steps aside. Forrest leaps a five-foot fence, narrating his life story, and runs along the high school road as the truck follows. He runs under the field goal post, through the end zone, and the crowd cheers as a football is kicked off. Forrest, in a University of Alabama uniform, receives the ball from a teammate. The coach, assistants, and players cheer as Forrest speeds past defenders. The coach yells from the sidelines as Forrest cuts toward the end zone, dodging players. He scores a touchdown, and the crowd cheers wildly. Forrest continues running, smashing through band members toward the team tunnel. The coach looks at an assistant as Chet Huntley appears on TV. test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A dedicated police officer carefully escorts Jenny to the location of her grandmother's trailer. Upon their arrival, Jenny's grandmother warmly greets her outside and gently guides her toward the entrance of the trailer. Later on, Jenny finds herself climbing over a second-floor railing, making her way into the house. She lies down in bed next to young Forrest, embracing him with a comforting hug. As they grow into teenagers, Forrest and Jenny are seen walking together along a picturesque, oak-lined road. Suddenly, Forrest is struck in the back by a rock. They both turn around to discover a teenage boy preparing to throw another rock, just as a pickup truck arrives on the scene. Jenny turns her gaze toward Forrest, who promptly drops his books and begins to run down the road. The teenage boy quickly jumps into the back of the pickup truck with another boy, and the truck accelerates in pursuit of Forrest. Jenny steps to the left to avoid the commotion. Forrest skillfully leaps over a five-foot fence as the boys attempt to catch up with him, all the while looking to his left and continuing to narrate his life story. He sprints along the road in front of the high school, with the truck hot on his heels and the boys pounding on the roof. Forrest dashes under the field goal post and through the end zone. The crowd erupts with excitement as a football is kicked off and players scatter across the field. Forrest is then seen wearing a University of Alabama football uniform, gazing up into the enthusiastic crowd as his teammate catches the kickoff and hands him the ball. The football coach, along with his assistants and the Alabama players, cheer enthusiastically for Forrest as he races across the field, swiftly maneuvering past both defending and opposing players. The football coach runs along the sidelines, shouting encouragement, while Forrest makes a sharp cut toward the sidelines, causing two opposing players to collide. The football coach, assistants, and players gesture for Forrest to head toward the end zone. Forrest turns up the sidelines and charges toward the end zone as some opposing players stumble in their attempts to catch him. He triumphantly runs into the end zone just as an opposing player dives at his feet, and the referee signals a touchdown amid the wild cheers of the crowd. Forrest continues his run, barreling through band members, and makes his way toward the team tunnel. The football coach exchanges a look with an assistant coach as an anchorman named Chet Huntley appears on television. Forrest walks through a throng of people and steps over to a young man as the crowd attentively observes the demonstration. Forrest proceeds toward the schoolhouse as a football coach watches a black and white television, where a newsman stationed outside the schoolhouse addresses the camera. The footage then transitions to Governor Wallace speaking with General Graham.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: A dedicated and vigilant police officer carefully escorts Jenny to the precise location of her grandmother's trailer, ensuring her safe arrival. Upon their arrival at the trailer, Jenny's grandmother warmly and affectionately greets her outside, gently guiding her with care and love toward the entrance of the trailer. Later on, Jenny finds herself skillfully climbing over a second-floor railing, making her way with determination into the house. She then lies down comfortably in bed next to young Forrest, embracing him with a comforting and reassuring hug. As they grow and mature into teenagers, Forrest and Jenny are seen walking together along a picturesque and scenic oak-lined road. Suddenly, Forrest is unexpectedly struck in the back by a rock, catching them both by surprise. They both instinctively turn around to discover a teenage boy preparing to throw yet another rock, just as a pickup truck arrives on the scene. Jenny turns her attentive gaze toward Forrest, who promptly drops his books and begins to run swiftly down the road. The teenage boy quickly jumps into the back of the pickup truck along with another boy, and the truck accelerates rapidly in hot pursuit of Forrest. Jenny wisely steps to the left to avoid the unfolding commotion. Forrest skillfully and with agility leaps over a five-foot fence as the boys attempt to catch up with him, all the while looking to his left and continuing to narrate the story of his life. He sprints energetically along the road in front of the high school, with the truck hot on his heels and the boys loudly pounding on the roof. Forrest dashes under the field goal post and through the end zone as the crowd erupts with excitement and enthusiasm. A football is kicked off, and players scatter swiftly across the field. Forrest is then seen wearing a University of Alabama football uniform, gazing up with admiration into the enthusiastic crowd as his teammate catches the kickoff and hands him the ball. The football coach, along with his dedicated assistants and the Alabama players, cheers enthusiastically and loudly for Forrest as he races across the field, swiftly maneuvering past both defending and opposing players with remarkable skill. The football coach runs energetically along the sidelines, shouting words of encouragement, while Forrest makes a sharp cut toward the sidelines, causing two opposing players to collide unintentionally. The football coach, his assistants, and the players gesture with urgency for Forrest to head toward the end zone. Forrest turns up the sidelines and charges determinedly toward the end zone as some opposing players stumble in their frantic attempts to catch him. He triumphantly runs into the end zone just as an opposing player dives at his feet, and the referee signals a touchdown amid the wild cheers and applause of the crowd. Forrest continues his run, barreling through band members, and makes his way toward the team tunnel. The football coach exchanges a meaningful look with an assistant coach as an anchorman named Chet Huntley appears on television. Forrest walks through a bustling throng of people and steps over to a young man as the crowd attentively observes the ongoing demonstration. Forrest proceeds purposefully toward the schoolhouse as a football coach watches a black and white television, where a newsman stationed outside the schoolhouse addresses the camera with authority. The footage then seamlessly transitions to Governor Wallace engaging in conversation with General Graham.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A police officer carefully guides Jenny along the path leading to her grandmother's trailer, ensuring her safety and providing a reassuring presence. As they approach the trailer, Jenny's grandmother emerges from the entrance, greeting them warmly and taking Jenny by the hand to lead her toward the trailer's welcoming interior. Later, Jenny finds herself on the second floor, where she deftly climbs over the railing with a sense of determination and enters the house. She quietly makes her way to the bedroom, where she gently lies down next to young Forrest, wrapping her arms around him in a comforting hug. As time passes and they grow into teenagers, Forrest and Jenny walk side by side along an oak-lined road, enjoying the peaceful surroundings until the tranquility is shattered when Forrest is abruptly struck in the back by a rock. Startled, they both turn around to identify the source of the attack and see a teenage boy preparing to throw another rock. At that moment, a pickup truck pulls up, and Jenny glances at Forrest, who instinctively drops his books and takes off running down the road. The teenage boy quickly jumps into the back of the pickup truck with another boy, and the truck accelerates in pursuit of Forrest, while Jenny steps to the left to avoid the commotion. Forrest, with agility and speed, leaps over a five-foot fence, evading his pursuers, and glances to the left as he continues narrating his life story. He sprints along the road in front of the high school, with the truck hot on his heels and the boys inside pounding on the roof in frustration. Forrest races under the field goal post and through the end zone, where the crowd erupts with excitement as a football is kicked off and players scatter across the field. In the next scene, Forrest is clad in a University of Alabama football uniform, gazing up at the cheering crowd as his teammate catches the kickoff and hands him the ball. The football coach, along with his assistants and fellow Alabama players, enthusiastically cheer for Forrest as he dashes across the field, skillfully maneuvering past both defending and opposing players. The football coach runs along the sidelines, shouting encouragement, while Forrest deftly cuts toward the sidelines, causing two opposing players to collide. The coach, assistants, and players energetically motion for Forrest to head toward the end zone. Responding to their signals, Forrest turns up the sidelines and sprints toward the end zone, leaving some opposing players stumbling in their attempts to catch him. He triumphantly crosses into the end zone just as an opposing player dives at his feet, and the referee raises his arms to signal a touchdown, prompting the crowd to cheer wildly. Unstoppable, Forrest continues his momentum, barreling through band members and making his way toward the team tunnel. Meanwhile, the football coach exchanges a look with an assistant coach as an anchorman named Chet Huntley appears on television. Forrest navigates through a crowd of people, stepping over to a young man as the crowd attentively observes the demonstration. He then walks purposefully toward the schoolhouse, where a football coach watches a black and white television, observing a newsman reporting live from outside the schoolhouse. The footage transitions to Governor Wallace engaged in conversation with General Graham.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: A police officer escorts Jenny to her grandmother's trailer, where her grandmother meets her and leads her inside. Later, Jenny climbs over a second-floor railing to join young Forrest in bed, hugging him. As teenagers, Forrest and Jenny walk along an oak-lined road when Forrest is struck by a rock thrown by a teenage boy. They turn to see the boy, who jumps into a pickup truck with another boy as it speeds toward Forrest. Jenny steps aside as Forrest drops his books and runs, leaping over a fence while narrating his life story. The truck chases him past the high school, with the boys pounding on the roof. Forrest runs under the field goal post and through the end zone, as a football game unfolds. Now in a University of Alabama football uniform, Forrest receives the ball from a teammate amid a cheering crowd. The football coach and players encourage him as he speeds past defenders. Forrest cuts toward the sidelines, causing two opposing players to collide, and runs into the end zone, evading a diving opponent. The referee signals a touchdown, and the crowd erupts in cheers. Forrest continues running through band members toward the team tunnel. Meanwhile, the football coach and an assistant watch an anchorman, Chet Huntley, on television. Forrest navigates through a crowd at a demonstration, then heads toward a schoolhouse as a football coach watches a news broadcast of a reporter outside the schoolhouse. The footage shifts to Governor Wallace speaking with General Graham.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
A police officer, part of the local force known for its community engagement, escorts Jenny to her grandmother's trailer, situated in a neighborhood often bustling with close-knit families. Jenny's grandmother, who raised Jenny since childhood, meets her outside and leads her toward the trailer that has been the family home for years. Later, Jenny, in a moment of nostalgia, climbs over a second-floor railing of her childhood home and enters the house, lying in bed next to young Forrest, a close friend from her neighborhood, and hugging him. 

As teenagers, Forrest and Jenny walk along an oak-lined road, a common feature of their Southern town, until Forrest is suddenly hit in the back with a rock. They turn around to see a teenage boy, known for causing trouble in school, throwing another rock just as a pickup truck, a common vehicle in rural areas, pulls up. Jenny turns and looks at Forrest, who drops his books and runs down the road, a known escape route from school bullies. The teenage boy jumps into the back of the pickup truck with another boy as the truck speeds after Forrest, and Jenny steps left to get out of the way. Forrest, leveraging his speed that earned him a track scholarship, leaps over a five-foot fence as the boys try to catch him and looks left while continuing to tell his life story, which includes overcoming numerous challenges. He runs along the road in front of the high school, known for its strong athletics program, as the truck chases him and the boys pound on the roof.

Forrest runs under the field goal post and through the end zone on the local high school field. The crowd, gathered for a Friday night game, roars with excitement as a football is kicked off and players run around the field. Forrest is seen in a University of Alabama football uniform, representing one of the nation's most storied college football teams, looking up into the cheering crowd as his teammate fields the kickoff and hands him the ball. The football coach, assistants, and Alabama players cheer for Forrest, a star recruit, as he runs across the field, speeds past defending and opposing players. The football coach runs along the sidelines yelling, aware of Forrest's potential to turn the game, while Forrest cuts toward the sidelines, and two opposing players collide.

The football coach, assistants, and players motion for Forrest to run toward the end zone. Forrest turns up the sidelines and runs toward the end zone as some opposing players, caught off guard by his speed, fall down, trying to catch him. He runs into the end zone as an opposing player dives at his feet, and the referee signals a touchdown as the crowd cheers wildly, recognizing Forrest's contribution to the team's success. Forrest continues to run, driven by his relentless energy, smashing through band members, and makes his way toward the team tunnel. 

The football coach looks at an assistant coach as an anchorman named Chet Huntley, a well-known figure of the 1960s, appears on television. Forrest walks through a crowd of people, gathered for a historical civil rights demonstration, and steps over to a young man as the crowd observes the demonstration. Forrest walks toward the schoolhouse during a time of great societal change, reflecting the tense atmosphere as a football coach looks at a black and white television, where a newsman outside the schoolhouse speaks to the camera. The footage then cuts to Governor Wallace, infamous for his segregationist stance during the civil rights era, speaking to General Graham.

test_cases.description: A police officer escorts Jenny to her grandmother's trailer where Jenny's grandmother meets her outside and leads her toward the trailer. Jenny later climbs over a secondfloor railing and enters the house lying in bed next to young Forrest and hugging him. Forrest walks through a crowd of people and steps over to a young man as the crowd observes the demonstration. Forrest walks toward the schoolhouse as a football coach looks at a black and white television where a newsman outside the schoolhouse speaks to the camera. The footage then cuts to Governor Wallace speaking to General Graham.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A firefighter guides Olivia to her cousin's cabin, where Olivia's cousin greets her indoors and drags her toward the cabin. Olivia eventually dives over a third-floor balcony and enters the lodge, sitting at the table next to young Oliver and tickling him. As preteens, Oliver and Olivia skip along a pine-covered path until Oliver is suddenly struck in the shoulder with a baseball. They spin around to see a preteen girl tossing another baseball, just as a minivan drives up. Olivia spins and glances at Oliver, who drops his gloves and sprints up the path. The preteen girl hops into the back of the minivan with another girl as the van races after Oliver, and Olivia steps right to move aside. Oliver vaults over a seven-foot gate as the girls attempt to grab him and peers right while continuing to recount his adventures. He sprints along the pathway beside the community center as the van pursues him, and the girls tap on the dashboard. Oliver dashes under the basketball hoop and through the finish line. The audience gasps with enthusiasm as a frisbee is tossed off and athletes dash across the court. Oliver is seen in a Louisiana State University soccer outfit, gazing up into the applauding audience as his teammate grabs the frisbee and hands him the disk. The soccer instructor, helpers, and LSU athletes cheer for Oliver as he dashes across the pitch, zooms past defending and competing athletes. The soccer instructor jogs along the touchline shouting, while Oliver veers toward the touchline, and two rival athletes crash. The soccer instructor, helpers, and athletes gesture for Oliver to head for the goal area. Oliver turns up the touchline and dashes toward the goal area as some rival athletes tumble, attempting to snag him. He charges into the goal area as a rival athlete lunges at his legs, and the umpire signals a goal as the audience applauds fervently. Oliver continues to sprint, barreling through musicians, and navigates his way toward the team tunnel. The soccer instructor glances at a helper as a sportscaster named Dan Rather emerges on television. Oliver strolls through a swarm of spectators and skips over to a young woman as the swarm watches the exhibition. Oliver strolls toward the courthouse as a soccer instructor glances at a colorless television, where a reporter outside the courthouse talks to the lens. The footage then shifts to Mayor Johnson conversing with Colonel Thompson.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A police officer takes Jenny to her grandmother's trailer, where she is welcomed. Jenny sneaks into the house and lies next to young Forrest, hugging him. As teenagers, Forrest and Jenny walk along an oak-lined road when a rock hits Forrest's back, thrown by a boy who pursues him in a pickup truck. Jenny steps aside and Forrest escapes by running, pursued by the truck. Eventually, Forrest speeds past defending players on a football field, earning cheers from the crowd and a touchdown. He continues running into the end zone and through band members. Later, Forrest is seen walking through a crowd at a demonstration, as a football coach watches news footage of Governor Wallace speaking to General Graham.
